abstract: It has been nearly three years since Sri Lankan government troops crushed the separatist Tamil Tigers in a gory, scorched-earth campaign that brought an end to three decades of civil war. But the fog of war has still not lifted: Sri Lanka said Tuesday that it won't be sending a review of alleged war crimes to the United Nations for discussion.

headline.main: The Fog of an Uncivil War in Sri Lanka
